nmisenh: my older sister, my older female parallel cousin
nmishoomenh: 1 my parallel uncle NB: Most speakers seem to no longer be familiar with precise ways kin terms distinguish nature of kinship (e.g. if uncle is father's brother or mother's brother). Nmishoomenh may be taken to be an informal term for my grandfather (nmishoo, nmishoomis) or simply "my uncle" whether on mother's side or father's side. 2 my grandfather

ziizbaakdoke: make [maple] sugar, make maple syrup
Ziizbaakdoke-giizis: Sugaring Moon (March)
ziizbaakdoons: candy
ziizbaakdwaaboo: maple sap
ziizbaakdwaapne: have sugar diabetes
ziizbaakot: sugar
ziizbidoon: drool
ziizbidoonengwaam: drool while sleeping
ziizningwaamaa: carry sth. (an.) squeezed under one's arm, hold sth. (an.) squeezed under one's arm
ziizningwaandaan: carry sth. squeezed under one's armhold sth. squeezed under one's arm
